subject: Re: [junit] Re: Prob. in extending TestCase class
msgSnippet: ... Absolutely and categorically incorrect. Each test (meaning test method) executes in a different instance of (your subclass of) TestCase. That is how JUnit
messageBody:
Jamie wrote:

> I think you want to encapsulate the call to the API that your tests use
> only once. Although it is usually wise to set up each individually test
> and this is why setUp and tearDown are so handy.
>
> However, it you really want to re-use an object throughout your tests
> create them in the constructor. The class that your tests are in will
> only be instantiated ONCE by the test framework.

Absolutely and categorically incorrect.

Each test (meaning test method) executes in a different instance of
(your subclass of) TestCase. That is how JUnit guarantees test fixture
isolation.
